alert.note: Alert for Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 19 at 9:56AM PST until December 19 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero possible. * WHERE...Creston, Harrington, Ephrata, Coulee City, Othello, Ritzville, Quincy, Odessa, Wilbur, Moses Lake, and Grand Coulee. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 3 PM PST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Watch, from late Tuesday night through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Persons are urged to stay indoors until conditions improve. If you must go outside, dress in layers. Several layers of clothes will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Cover exposed skin to reduce your risk of frostbite or hypothermia. Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will keep you from losing your body heat. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Moses Lake Area; Upper Columbia Basin
